content.question: Which of the following can best be concluded about United States involvement in the First World War based on the point of view expressed in the excerpt?

choices.label: Americans did not assert rights of neutrality early in the war.
The vast majority of popular opinion was in favor of declaring war.
Joining the war was a departure from the traditional foreign policy of nonintervention.
Cultural connections made Americans sympathetic toward the Allied Powers.

content.answer: Joining the war was a departure from the traditional foreign policy of nonintervention.
